cooking_method: In a large skillet, brown the ground beef. Add onions and garlic and cook until softened. Stir in tomatoes, wine, oregano, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 30 minutes. Serve over cooked spaghetti.

Cook chicken in a skillet until no longer pink. Cook pasta according to package directions. In a separate pan, heat cream and garlic until simmering. Stir in cheese, salt, and pepper. Serve chicken and sauce over pasta.

ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (bell peppers, broccoli, carrots)
cooking_method: Stir-fry tofu and garlic in a large skillet. Add vegetables and cook until tender. Stir in soy sauce, sesame oil, and ginger. Serve over rice or noodles.

ingredients: Toppings of your choice (pepperoni, mushrooms, bell peppers, onions, etc.)
cooking_method: Roll out pizza dough and spread tomato sauce on it. Sprinkle cheese, add your favorite toppings, and sprinkle with basil and oregano. Bake at 450°F for 12-15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350°F. In a mixing bowl, cream butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Stir in flour and chocolate chips. Drop spoonfuls onto a baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes.

Tear lettuce into bite-sized pieces and place in a large bowl. Add croutons and Parmesan cheese. In a small bowl, whisk together Caesar dressing, garlic, and lemon juice. Pour over the salad and toss to coat.
In a skillet, brown the ground beef and stir in taco seasoning. Heat taco shells in the oven. Fill each shell with beef, cheese, lettuce, tomato, and a dollop of sour cream.

Marinate chicken in yogurt and Tikka Masala spice blend. Grill or bake the chicken until cooked through. In a separate pan, heat tomato sauce, heavy cream, and butter. Serve chicken and sauce over cooked rice.
In a large skillet, brown pork. Add peppers, onion, and pineapple. Stir in sweet and sour sauce. Cook until heated through. Serve over cooked rice.

ingredients: 1 lb chicken breast, cooked and shredded
cooking_method: In a large pot, combine chicken broth, carrots, celery, onion, and garlic. Simmer until vegetables are tender. Add cooked chicken and egg noodles. Simmer until noodles are cooked.

In a skillet, brown ground beef, onions, and garlic. Stir in tomato sauce and crushed tomatoes. In a baking dish, layer noodles, beef mixture, ricotta, and mozzarella. Repeat and bake at 375°F for 30 minutes.
In a bowl, combine avocados, tomato, onion, cilantro, and garlic. Add lime juice, salt, and pepper. Mix well and serve with tortilla chips.

In a large bowl, combine apples, granulated sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Place one pie crust in a pie dish and add the apple mixture. Dot with butter. Cover with the second pie crust and crimp the edges. Brush with milk and sprinkle with sugar. Bake at 425°F for 45-50 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, brown sugar, garlic, and cornstarch. In a skillet, stir-fry beef until browned. Add broccoli and sauce. Cook until sauce thickens. Serve over cooked rice.

In a bowl, mix chicken, 1/2 cup cheese, and 1/2 cup onion. Fill tortillas and roll up. Place in a baking dish and pour enchilada sauce over them. Sprinkle with remaining cheese and onion. Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes. Serve with sour cream and olives.

ingredients: 1 can kidney beans, drained and rinsed
cooking_method: In a large pot, sauté carrots, celery, onion, and garlic. Add tomatoes, beans, and vegetable broth. Simmer for 20 minutes. Add pasta and cook until tender.
In a bowl, mix yogurt and Tikka Masala spice blend. Thread paneer, bell pepper, and onion onto skewers. Grill until charred. Drizzle with lemon juice and serve.
